1:
One who isolates himself seeks his own desire\q and he quarrels with all sound judgment.
\q
2:
A fool finds no pleasure in understanding,\q but only in revealing what is in his own heart.


\q
3:
When a wicked person comes, contempt comes with him—\q along with shame and reproach.
\q
4:
The words of a man's mouth are deep waters;\q the fountain of wisdom is a flowing stream.
 

\q
5:
It is not good to be partial to the wicked person,\q nor to deny justice to the righteous person.
\q
6:
A fool's lips bring him conflict\q and his mouth invites a beating.


\q
7:
A fool's mouth is his ruin\q and he ensnares himself with his lips.
\q
8:
The words of a gossip are like delicious morsels\q and they go down into the inner parts of the body.


\q
9:
Also, one who is slack in his work\q is a brother to the one who destroys the most.
\q
10:
The name of Yahweh is a strong tower;\q the righteous person runs into it and is safe.


\q
11:
The wealth of the rich is his fortified city\q and in his imagination it is like a high wall.
\q
12:
Before his downfall a person's heart is proud,\q but humility comes before honor.


\q
13:
One who answers before listening—\q it is his folly and shame.
\q
14:
A person's spirit will survive sickness,\q but a broken spirit who can bear it?


\q
15:
The heart of the intelligent acquires knowledge\q and the hearing of the wise seeks it out.
\q
16:
A man's gift may open the way\q and bring him before an important person.


\q
17:
The first to plead his case seems right\q until his opponent comes and questions him.
\q
18:
Casting the lot settles disputes\q and separates strong opponents.


\q
19:
An offended brother is harder to be won than a strong city,\q and quarreling is like the bars of a castle.
\q
20:
From the fruit of his mouth one's stomach is filled;\q with the harvest of his lips he is satisfied.


\q
21:
Death and life are controlled by the tongue,\q and those who love the tongue will eat its fruit.
\q
22:
He who finds a wife finds a good thing\q and receives favor from Yahweh.


\q
23:
A poor person pleads for mercy,\q but a rich person answers harshly.
\q
24: The one who claims many friends is brought to ruin by them,\q but there is a friend who comes closer than a brother.
